article:
'Productive capacity' is a term used to define maximum possible output of an
economy. According to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Development
(UNCTAD), no agreed-upon definition exists. UNCTAD itself proposes: "the
productive resources, entrepreneurial capabilities and production linkages which
together determine the capacity of a country to produce goods and services." The
term may also be applied to individual resources or assets; for instance the
productive capacity of an area of farmland.
